caption: A ruin exploration adventure for 1st level characters
description:
A terrible storm is brewing – you must find shelter from this accursed weather, and quickly! Veldmark, the nearest town, is over ten leagues away, so your only choice is the ruined fort on a nearby hill. As you approach, a faint cry echoes from deep within the decrepit structure. The hair on the back of your neck stands up in warning, but perhaps it was just the wind. Perhaps. Gathering up your courage, you enter the halls of the Grimhill fort.

Written and designed by:

Aleksandar Kostić aka Art of Caustic

Editing and proofreading by:

Alex Bates

Follow us on:

instagram.com/reverse_ettin_games

and

reverse-ettin-games.itch.io

folders.name: The Tragic Curse of Grimhill Fort
The Tragic Curse of Grimhill Fort
The Tragic Curse of Grimhill Fort
The Tragic Curse of Grimhill Fort
The Tragic Curse of Grimhill Fort

system.description:
A dead body you touch answers your questions in a distant, wheezing voice.

You can ask the dead body up to three yes or no questions (one at a time). The GM truthfully answers "yes" or "no" to each.

If you cast this spell more than once in 24 hours, treat a failed spellcasting check for it as a critical failure, instead.

An ornate blade mounted on a jeweled iron handle.

Bonus. +1 longsword. +2 if used against undead.

Benefit. if used by a cleric, AC+1 against undead.

text.content:
• Wind howls through the cracks in the stone walls.

  • Chandelier is hanging from one of the beams. Pigeons have built a nest on it.

  • Debris and wooden beams on the ground.

  • Firewood and broken crates lie stacked against the wall. There is a wood-chopping axe leaning by the door to @UUID[.bvxmidCgjlPqhx9d]{Area 2}.

  • Voices can be heard from the Area 2, DC 11 to hear two people arguing who’s turn it is feed the hounds downstairs.

  • Stone stairs lead directly to @UUID[.tmHJS0tRpu0TIHVk]{Area 10}. Anyone climbing the stairs may alert sentries above. Loose stones make noise, DC 11 to pass undetected.

@UUID[Macro.cXQ9S5xGUfUxM8N0]{Reveal Area 1+2}

• Barrels and crates are piled up all around the room. They provide some cover. The crates are mostly empty, the rest are full of stolen goods (200 gp but really heavy).

  • A pulley system hangs above the large open trapdoor. Long chain hangs down the hatch leading to @UUID[.np2baXNQjXueMReA]{Area 7}.

  • Two @UUID[Actor.ry0N3R6hXcfJJ0Lv]{nasty-looking ruffians} are yelling at each other, arguing, while the third one enjoys the show. They can be surprised, but will attack the party on sight otherwise.

@UUID[Macro.cXQ9S5xGUfUxM8N0]{Reveal Area 1+2}

• The door to this room is locked with a seal, can be smashed with DC 17, but will make a loud noise and alert everyone in the fort. Opens with a special key located in @UUID[.UZHErFFniq0BzLzn]{Area 12}.

  • Rotten tapestries display knights and kings jousting. There is a wooden chair and a table. If touched, all crumbles to dust.

  • Heavy iron chest is pinned underneath fallen stone blocks. Can be pulled out with DC 10. Contains a golden statuette of a young woman (50 gp), plated silver gloves, and a @UUID[Item.EyS2PAd9l6bLuW1a]{magic longsword}. If the statuette is taken, a ghost of a sad woman will appear in the room, somberly looking at the door. The ghost is silent and harmless but will permanently reduce CON by [[/r 1d8]] points to anyone who breaks the statuette. This is the ghost of a skeleton in the @UUID[.ixcJq6DNfCXGJeOu]{Area 8}.

  • Reinforced wooden trapdoor leads to @UUID[.ixcJq6DNfCXGJeOu]{Area 8}. The door was locked once, but now, the mechanism is rusty and broken beyond repair.

@UUID[Macro.RTU8YHH15jEALEqv]{Reveal Area 3}

• The southern door of this room is unlocked, but closed and reinforced with iron bars.

  • Beautiful frescoes are still visible on the walls, displaying a knight and a lady in love, riding a winged horse.

  • Shallow fountian full of buzzing flies and mosquitoes reeks of stale sewage. If searched (DC 13), a silver ring (10 gp) can be found at the bottom.

  • Grey stormy skies can be seen from below. The first raindrops are already here.

  • The eastern door is missing from the hinges, the busy interior of @UUID[.VtLjQm8kYPJ4NyBy]{Area 5} can be seen from here.

@UUID[Macro.dPYPPw44ObNwcDXY]{Reveal Area 4+5}

• Bright orange flame illuminates the room as three @UUID[Actor.ry0N3R6hXcfJJ0Lv]{bandits} huddled together next to a fireplace, play card games and rolling dice. Surprisingly, they are quiet, trying their best not to wake up their sleeping comrades.

  • Big iron bell is next to the gambling bandits. If the bandits notice the characters, they will ring the bell and alert all the bandits in the fort. The bell is very old, intricately engraved, and was stolen months ago, it is worth 10 gp, or 100 gp if sold to the right buyer.

  • Seven bunkbeds are in this room. Two bunkbeds have occupants - four sleeping bandits.

  • Large and empty king-sized bed is next to the ladder leading to @UUID[.rHhUVHhmUFRXYSvZ]{Area 11}. There is a @UUID[Item.seWGReDDSkaKffvl]{dagger +1} hidden under its dirty pillows.

  • Two chests are by the large bed. The smaller one is unlocked and looks empty. It has a hidden compartment, DC 15 to notice it. Inside is a magic @UUID[Item.wErvoBzzV5xMaG3m]{Scroll of Speak with Dead} and a strange locket. The locket shows a portrait of someone you wish to remember. Currently, it holds an image of a five year old girl. The large chest is locked, DC 13 to unlock. It contains a variety of coins and jewelry (150 gp).

  • Trapdoor on the ceiling of this room is locked, DC 13 to open. The trapdoor leads to @UUID[.rHhUVHhmUFRXYSvZ]{Area 11}.

@UUID[Macro.dPYPPw44ObNwcDXY]{Reveal Area 4+5}

• The ground is muddy and sticky. Movement is difficult, DC 10 or get stuck in the mud. Spend an action to pull yourself out.

  • Snarls can be heard in the darkness. Two @UUID[Actor.b0kmgW3NFVkmMeA7]{wolves} are poised to strike! They will attack any character carrying a torch.

  • Malodorous pond is on the western part of the cavern and the way leads to @UUID[.aCJWSl7XWHmPy11V]{Area 8}, but the stones have caved in and it is impossible to go through unless the rocks are cleared. It takes an hour to clear.

  • There is a corpse of a middle-aged human floating in the pond. The corpse is bloated and full of leeches and flesh-eating snails. If inspected, the corpse will reveal an unreadable soaked letter, and a children’s silver bracelet (10 gp) in the envelope.

  • Hidden door on the north wall! Touching the cave walls reveals a faux rock - painted surprisingly well, DC 13 to notice. The door leads to @UUID[.np2baXNQjXueMReA]{Area 7}.

@UUID[Macro.frnguPzv0a9iYwlS]{Reveal Area 6}

• Smell of mold and vinegar wafts through the room. Broken bottles lie all around the corners. There is a 2-in-6 chance that a bottle of old elven vintage worth 15 gp is still intact. Tastes great!

  • Big cluster of mushrooms on the ceiling illuminates the room in vibrant hues of blue and purple.

  • Four thick wooden beams hold the ceiling in place. They are a new addition to this room. If at least two of the beams are broken or removed in some way, the ceiling will collapse and kill everyone in the room.

  • Rusty steel ladder bolted in the wall leads to @UUID[.bvxmidCgjlPqhx9d]{Area 2}.

@UUID[Macro.ydmghxCQB5X3r7pv]{Reveal Area 7}

• Damp and slippery. Everything is covered by a layer of slime and hundreds upon hundreds of fat slugs. Step on them, they pop!

  • Chains and manacles are bolted into dungeon walls. Moldy skeletons are attached to some of them.

  • Human skeleton lies on the floor, adorned in rotting court dress, with dirty pieces of jewelry (30 gp) still attached to it. Bones of the skeleton appear to be broken, as if it was thrown from above. This is the skeleton of a ghost in the @UUID[.j3rnEtiH1zcaYTxV]{Area 3}.

  • Rickety ladder made of wood is swarmed by slugs. The wood is rotten, and climbing the ladder takes some effort, DC 9. The ladder leads to @UUID[.j3rnEtiH1zcaYTxV]{Area 3}.

  • Three fat @UUID[Actor.aQa0g6rrazakogL9]{giant rats} are living in this room, feeding off of slugs. They are well fed and will not attack, unless provoked.

@UUID[Macro.IjRL5CnhEuQ28X4X]{Reveal Area 8}

• The storm is getting closer. The wind begins to rage. It is not safe outside anymore.

  • Ground is littered with broken stones and stone slabs. Movement is noisy, and a bit difficult, but not impossible.

  • Sturdy reinforced door to the east leads to @UUID[.tmHJS0tRpu0TIHVk]{Area 10}. The door is barred from the inside, DC 17 to force open.

  • Broken door to the north leads to @UUID[.UZHErFFniq0BzLzn]{Area 12}. “Do not enter!” is written on one of the planks. @UUID[Macro.Ez9UktmBz5aJKSd8]{Display Door Sign}

• Two @UUID[Actor.ry0N3R6hXcfJJ0Lv]{bandits} and their sergeant guard the wall section from this small chamber. There is 2-in-6 chance that the bandits are currently looking through the door, making it impossible for anyone to pass through @UUID[.xSlMyvtRLzs0Jh8j]{Area 9} undetected for [[/r 3d10]] minutes.

  • Three sleeping bags are placed around a bonfire. There is a pouch of gold (10 gp) and a throwing @UUID[Compendium.shadowdark.gear.Item.C3mc5OlKPSJNMrng]{dagger} in one of the bags.

  • Stairway on the south leads to @UUID[.sBfbdldBV24BZ5a1]{Area 1}.

@UUID[Macro.jWVzO07WFic42sV0]{Reveal Area 10}

• Half of the roof is missing. Beams are broken and most shingles are gone. Pigeons nest here now.

  • Weapon racks and armor stands lay empty, piled up against the north wall.

  • Heavy iron door to the west is busted open and bent, unable to close again, leading to @UUID[.UZHErFFniq0BzLzn]{Area 12}. The weight of stones and beams appears to be the culprit.

  • Fresh corpse of a man dressed in green robes lies next to two dead stingbats, both cut in half. His body is full of stingbat punctures, not a single drop of blood left in it. He clutches a silver dagger +1 and a @UUID[.2LLiIJVKJSgxbNQt]{journal}. The robed man also wears an old ruby ring (15 gp) and a silk pouch with gems (30 gp). In his pocket is a pair of keys, one opens the large chest in @UUID[.VtLjQm8kYPJ4NyBy]{Area 5}, the other is for the trapdoor in this room.

  • Trapdoor on the south-eastern corner of this room is locked, DC 13 to open. The trapdoor leads to @UUID[.VtLjQm8kYPJ4NyBy]{Area 5}.

@UUID[Macro.q463B9B3G48qlqjn]{Reveal Area 11}

• The tower has collapsed from the inside, only the moss-covered walls still stand.

  • A sudden flash of lightning illuminates the place, revealing four @UUID[Actor.Mk3OW3RSgGNSkcuC]{stingbats} hanging from the support beams. They attack!

  • Armored knight lies dead in the rubble. The knight wears rusty platemail and a shield with a crest lost to time. Next to the knight is a locked chest, DC 17. Inside it are a golden statuette of a young man (50 gp), a long emerald necklace (70 gp), and a jeweled crown (150 gp). If the characters attempt to open the chest or interfere with it in some way, the knight will rise as a @UUID[Actor.vOHaLShvVtwFfEfY]{wight} and attack. The wight has a special key to @UUID[.j3rnEtiH1zcaYTxV]{Area 3} attached to its belt.

  • Iron door to the east leads to @UUID[.rHhUVHhmUFRXYSvZ]{Area 11}.

  • Broken door to the south leads to @UUID[.xSlMyvtRLzs0Jh8j]{Area 9}.

• Wooden signpost that says “You are not welcome here!”. @UUID[Macro.QahTnsu8DxLH8X6F]{Display Signpost}

  • A gust of wind knocks a few branches and pebbles from the ruined walls above.

  • Sturdy oaken door, slightly ajar, squeaks loudly if not opened with caution, DC 9.

• Faint stench of wet dogs permeates the air. Not even the smell of fresh rain can hide it.

  • The cave entrance is hidden by branches and tall grass. It can be seen from the road, DC 13.

  • There are bones littered around the entrance. Mostly animal, but some are certainly human.

@UUID[Macro.OqbpswnpOTt5DpIl]{Reveal Hidden Cave Enterance}

• Broken wall overgrown in vines is somewhat challenging to climb, DC 13. Failure by five or more will loosen some of the stones which will deal [[/r 1d4]] damage to the closest person below, DC 9 for half damage. Once the loose stones fall, the vines will be much easier to climb, DC 9.

  • Some vines have thorns that deal one point of damage to anyone without gloves. There are old blood stains on the vines.

  • Oddly beautiful skull shaped white roses grow on the vines. They smell of sorrow.

If the characters discover both golden statuettes (from @UUID[.j3rnEtiH1zcaYTxV]{Area 3} and @UUID[.UZHErFFniq0BzLzn]{Area 12}), they will notice that the statues fit together perfectly. If the statuettes are reunited, the ghost in @UUID[.j3rnEtiH1zcaYTxV]{Area 3} will vanish, and the wight in @UUID[.UZHErFFniq0BzLzn]{Area 12} will turn to dust, and the words “Glad to see you again, my love...“ will echo in the wind. @UUID[Macro.Yps87krKC1XMf4uf]{Display Echo in the Wind}. All of a sudden, the storm will subside, the rain stop, and the sky will turn blue once more.

Written and designed by:

Aleksandar Kostić aka Art of Caustic

Editing and proofreading by:

Alex Bates

Follow us on:

instagram.com/reverse_ettin_games

facebook.com/ReverseEttinGames

twitter.com/ReverseEttin

and

reverse-ettin-games.itch.io

The Tragic Curse of Grimhill Fort is an independent product published under the Shadowdark RPG Third-Party License and is not affiliated with The Arcane Library, LLC. Shadowdark RPG © 2023 The Arcane Library, LLC.

If the characters decide to take some time to read the journal, they will find boring notes about stolen goods and how the spoils were being divided. They will also learn about the gang’s hierarchy. Osgarl the magician is the bandit leader, while Bert the sergeant is his second in command.

In his journal, Osgarl also mentions that he has chosen Grimhill Fort as the base of his operations because the place has quite the unique history. He mentions undying love and tragic and unfortunate imprisonment of a noblewoman, and murderous rivalry between two knights - two brothers.

In his research, Osgarl has discovered that the unexplored stringbat-infested tower hides intriguing treasures. He also addresses their value and his unwillingness to share with Bert and his crew. This is why Osgarl wanted to delve in all by himself, until his sudden and untimely death.
